de.iabg.mode
Class OrthogonalityCheckModel

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.mode.OrthogonalityCheckModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, ModeCorrelationModel, Loggable
public class OrthogonalityCheckModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModeCorrelationModel

This implementation of ModeCorrelationModel attempts to create all the functionality described in the ModeCorrelationModel class description. Refer to the class API for more details. Much of the implementation of this class should be straight-forward, however, a more in-depth summary of the connection algorithm may clarify some conceptual issues. There exist two ModeMatrix objects, one for the First Modes and one for the Last Modes. A ModeCorrelationMatrix is created by calling ModeMatrix.getReducedOrthogonalityCheck(de.iabg.mode.MassMatrix, de.iabg.mode.ModeMatrix, de.iabg.swing.KeyList, de.iabg.swing.KeyList, de.iabg.swing.KeyList, de.iabg.swing.KeyList) and using the selected mass matrix,First Modes, Last Modes, and their corresponding mode keys as arguments. Once that has been completed, a ModeConnectionMatrix with a minimum correlation tolerance is created by calling ModeCorrelationMatrix.getPreferredConnection(double). In these two steps, the two ModeMatrix objects are connected. The user can change the connection by simply changing the values in the JTable provided. Changes in this table are backed by the ModeConnectionMatrix, so no additional action must be taken. To render the correlated modes in Java3D, instances of ModeCorrelationScene2D and ModeCorrelationScene3D are used.

Version:
September 14, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Constructor Detail

OrthogonalityCheckModel

public OrthogonalityCheckModel(JModeMirrorPanel modeMirrorPanel,
                               JMeshConnectionPanel meshConnectionPanel)
Constructs a OrthogonalityCheckModel with no stored data. This constructor also initializes all the storage objects, which should not be destroyed during the life of this object. This is because listeners may register themselves to these objects, and will not receive notifications if the references to these objects are changed.

Parameters:
modeMirrorPanel - the JModeMirrorPanel
meshConnectionPanel - the JMeshConnectionPanel
